intro: Hieracium confragifolium, commonly known as the broken-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grassy areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are often deeply lobed and can be hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium confragifolium is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
